website_summaries.verdict: These are excellent smart bulbs, but it's tough to justify the splurge unless you catch them on sale.
pros: The Lifx Mini puts out plenty of light, and offers all of the colors, features, and integrations that you get with standard-size Lifx bulbs at a lower cost
cons: At $45 each, the color-changing Mini bulbs are still awfully expensive, and the design still doesn't cast enough downward light
The pairing process, newly revamped to align with HomeKit, is also a little more confusing than it ought to be

customer_reviews.title: Constant reprogramming
customer_reviews.text: In theory, these lights are great. Once you go through the arduous process of getting them attached to your wifi and connected to your phone, they can do some pretty cools stuff. Keeping them attached to the wifi and working is a whole lot harder than they let on. These lights constantly disconnect and you get to go thru the whole setup process again... My suggestion, wait until their firmware improves or buy from another vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't connect, maaaaannnny people have problems
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all with connecting. Many forums online with people having same issues. I would avoid till a fix comes out and pay the extra $15 orso and get the colored ones they have (LIFX (A19) Wi-Fi Smart LED Light Bulb, Adjustable, Multicolor, Dimmable, No Hub Required, Works with Alexa, Apple HomeKit and Google Assistant ). I won't leave LIFX for lights because of that bulb and hoping that they come up with a fix for the broken product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you got the right HomeKit code
customer_reviews.text: Bulb is great. It works as advertised. However I bought this bulb through Amazon Warehouse deals, and had a really hard time to set it up to work with HomeKit. Included HomeKit code was invalid.I am guessing they got the manual out of some other packaging. Finally I got right code which is printed on the bulb under the serial number and everything works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: E. P.

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity issues made these frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I got these and the larger full color ones, same brand. The one that I could connect to do everything, even through Echo was cool. But the mini wouldn’t connect to echo and no others would connect to anything. Very frustrating. I tried all the trouble shooting I could find, and wrote to the company. They offered suggestions, but nothing worked. Sadly I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: purple panda

customer_reviews.title: Great to set your circadian rhythm throughout your home.
customer_reviews.text: I use these everywhere. I'm controlling them locally with Hubitat, alongside a circadian rhythm app that changes the color temperature based on the location of the sun in the sky. There is a built-in LIFX app that does this also, but it doesn't allow you to turn the lights off. There are a few ways around that. In the early days of LIFX they had a lot of issues, were flaky, and left people frustrated. I think those days are over, since my lights have been rock solid for over a year. Get em.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Disaster to set up. Support lacking!!!! I wish I could give 0 stars
customer_reviews.text: Set up is not intuitive. No tech support by phone. Can not connect it to Alexa. Buy at your own risk. I have 2 sets and will not buy any more . For the price it’s disappointing. I finally had it set up then it disconnected and tried their "tech support". In short. Get a Tylenol or Advil handy before you attempt to interact with their tech support online or on rare occasion by phone. I gave up. They are textbook case of how not to provide tech support. I eventually gave up and returned all bulbs. Do NOT buy this item
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT ... :)
customer_reviews.text: - I've purchased LIFX Mini Color 4 Pack it's cool, and it's my first time trying these smart LED light - Works wonderfully , the set up was very easy. - This bulb base size is E26 and working great with bulb base E27 Without any problems ... :), as i have it in my deck lamp & floor lamp also the ciling lamp . - I strongly advise people who are looking for such colorful bulbs. - No Hub Required, And this is a very good point. - The LIFX app is easy to use and has some cool options. - Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nezar

customer_reviews.title: okay, but
customer_reviews.text: Update 2019: With recent changes, I can now change the color of the bulb in the Home app. I am lifting my review from three to four stars, but am leaving it below five due to problems where after turning it off (10pm) before it’s scheduled to go off on its own (11pm), the bulb sometimes turns itself on (10:15pm). This is very disruptive. This bulb is fine mostly. The critical problem for me though is that despite having an adjustable color temperature, the homekit support doesn’t include a characteristic for color temperature. The Lifx app is terrible, and makes it very frustrating to automate this bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Beiser

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year, lights no longer connect to wifi - SO FRUSTRATING!
customer_reviews.text: I, luckily, only own 3 Lifx bulbs, just over 1 year. They stopped connecting to my wifi despite a new eero hub with beacons that provide coverage throughout my house. I don't live in a densely populated neighborhood so other issues with wifi overload don't apply. Support is only by email, takes several days for a response, then offers simple solutions that don't work and who has time to try again every several days? I'm done with Lifx. I expected more for the price. They were great while they worked and have sold me on voice activated controls, just not Lifx.
customer_reviews.author: CDH

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs, some of the themes don't work well if clustered
customer_reviews.text: The set up was a little difficult, but check LIFX's support documents on Wifi configuration. There was a setting I needed to turn off that resolved a lot of my problems with these bulbs. I use these in ceiling fixtures that fit three bulbs each. They all work pretty well but trying to coordinate more than one bulb with some of LIFX's custom effects it seems like I initially only works for one and then when trying to tweak it the other bulbs work but not in sync. Otherwise great light reproduction and works great with Google Home.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus N.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, with a great app.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly a great buy. Love the app with the different colors it provides. The ability to sync it with alexa/google, with the fast response is sweet. I did have some trouble connecting it to alexa, as I initially had the light far from my router. If you are using alexa you must enable 2 smart skills so you don't have to use "alexa ask lifx to ..." but thats on Amazon and their software. Sync with google was fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rusbel Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, will not stay connected to the WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy and integration with Amazon echo and Apple home kit works well. The app is well designed and easily customizable. One big downside, if you loose WiFi for any reason, reconnecting and accessing the bulbs functionality is problematic and can require multiple resets to reconnects. 3/27... these bulbs keep dropping off my network randomly. I’m running a router 3 ASUS AIMesh system and have strong WiFi throughout my home and all 6 of my lifx devices are less than 20 feet from a router and still drop off. I have 25 iDevice devices and do not have the same issues with there connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Tippery

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lights, simple and easy to use! Tons of features through the app!
customer_reviews.text: I got to say I LOVE the LIFX products. Snarky lights that don’t need a hub and work with most of the most popular assistants and smart speakers (HomeKit, Alexa and Google). The app is top notch and can do just about anything you can think off with the lights and colors. I really like the new more traditional and smaller design of the A19 mini Color. Their pair very quickly, you name them and off you go. Easy to access them through your favorite smart assistant and change the settings from colors to intensity or any other variety. They also can be set to a timer/dusk to dawn, etc through the app. Great quality product! I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Try another product
customer_reviews.text: The product is pretty far from polished. Set up sounds like it should be pretty straight forward however the next step is never what you expect. Their support is the reason for 1 star though. I am pretty tech savvy and their support is very presumptuous and simply doesn’t listen and lend a hand to a solution. They only provided reasons as to why it wasn’t working not what the next step is. Plugging in a similar competitor bulb it worked in one shot further proving something was wrong with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: Overall great.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a little over a year and intially looked at replacing all my lightbulbs with these but because the original owners installed half of the ceiling lights with small sockets instead of standard ones I ended up using these only for lamps. Once connected they are pretty easy to use either from the app or from google home. My only issue so far has been in power outages I can't make sure that when the power comes back on the light won't there's been twice now where I've gone to bet without power only to be woken up when my bedside light turns on with the power.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Top end lights at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs. They were inexpensive, and integrated nicely with Alexa. I am very happy that LIFX supports my Amazon Fire 7 tablet with their LIFX app. These bulbs do exactly what i expected. I had no trouble installing them and connecting them to my smart home. I have four of these bulbs in a ceiling fan - yes, I am using an adapter (from medium base to candleabra). These bulbs are so bright (in a group of four) that I typically have them set at a dimmed setting. In the morning, I have them set at 30% brightness to wake me up. Very pleased with my purchase, I would recommend these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Crippled by the latest updates to the software
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, and they were great additions to the Alexa setup until the last firmware update and application update released from LifX. Now neither will connect to anything, the software will not connect to the cloud, and they cannot be reset. Technical support has been singularily unhelpful despite detailed communication of the issues as well as diagnostic outputs. I understand that everyone is dealing with COVID related issues , but since there is no way to roll back changes, right now there is no difference between these and plain ordinary bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Brauer

customer_reviews.title: Great mood lights
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs. My electric bill has dropped dramatically, they have a full spectrum of colors and they are fun to program for different settings. Although they are a little confusing to set up initially, once you have it figured out it's simple. I'm still pretty sure technology is going to eradicate mankind, but at least I can tell alexa I want to see magenta one more time before she wipes my brain and I wind up as another episode of black mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Output not impressive
customer_reviews.text: Using this with HomeKit. Took forever to get this bulb up and running due to having bought multiple LIFX bulbs at the same time...didn’t realize that bar code in each bulb’s package was mandatory to have. I’m disappointed in the brightness of this bulb and really shocked that LIFX doesn’t include any way in its app to select color temperatures for the light with any specifity. I don’t generally need all the “disco colors.” I would appreciate designated Kelvin temperatures that can be saved. The same goes for the exotic colors these bulbs can produce—how about something like the macOS color pickers, or though they’re for print colors, Pantone-type color settings?
customer_reviews.author: Mike The D.

customer_reviews.title: It has a mind of its own.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Bulb has died. Will not turn on or off. I recommend a different smart bulb. Compared to TP-Link, I highly prefer TP-Link. This LIFX bulb refuses to work with Alexa at least once a week. Right now, it's turning on and off by itself. Freaky. Alexa says it's not responding. The LIFX official app can't get it to respond either. It's just doing its own thing. This isn't a rare occurrence, just another bug with this darn bulb. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lai

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, high quality item.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the many color functions of this yet, but I have played with it early on and it was cool. I have used the white light features up to now, such as changing brightness, with such commands being integrated into Alexa. It has lost connectivity on rare occasion, but usually reconnects within 10 minutes I would say. Its not like its the only wireless device to ever drop out once in a rare while. It has been solid for me for the last 6+ months so I cant complain. Worth the price for all of its functions and I use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great lights for a better price!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of the full sized LIFX lights, but this was my first time ordering these mini lights. I put these in a few new cheap lamps I ordered from Target. They give off a lot of light but not nearly as much as the full sized lights, but then again, it is cheaper. The day and dusk means that it doesn’t change colors but instead stays within the colors of the sun. I was surprised by how orange the light could get...it’s like the color of fire! Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Not only was this product impossible to connect to other devices, there is NO in-person support. I saved myself a lot of hassell by purchasing a comparable product through phillips and feit.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the worst thing I've ever bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I can't express how frustrating this thing is. I'm not at all a computer or wifi novice but I struggled for literall hours to get this to hook up to wifi and Alexa, then suddenly , it was recognized and worked beautifully. I got rid of the box it came in and lived happily for 3 days then suddenly it dropped off the network and I can not get it recognized again. The lifex app is no help at all as it says the bulb is "sleeping". I would have returned if I hadn't got rid of original box. I would never recommend this to anyone, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these things
customer_reviews.text: I now own two of these bulbs. I had read that previous versions had connectivity issues, mine have has exactly zero issues. They are bright with extremely vivid colors. The perfect alternative to those who dont want to deal with hue bridges and overpriced bulbs. The wifi connection was painless although full disclosure the app did crash during firmware update the first time, never happened again and it wasnt a big deal. I took away 1 star for alexa integration because she can only control color and brightness. None of the effects are accessible without using the app directly.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B.

customer_reviews.title: Good when working but frustrating set up
customer_reviews.text: As others have written, difficult to set up. Needs security processes like VPN, firewalls, etc turned off to install, yet instructions don't explain that. During install there was some very fuzzy language about needing to turn off some feature that my G10+ didnt even have. Even with all security features off, it took several tries each time I added more bulbs to set up. Slow and frustrating. That said, once set up they have worked well with Alexa. Better instructions would have saved much frustration.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Reiter

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Period!!
customer_reviews.text: It shouldn't be this difficult to connect a Wi-Fi bulb. I'm disappointed that it was even offered with my new echo dot. It's not run by Smart Home, requires a separate app and THAT app is difficult to set up the connection. Once I finally got it to connect, the connection was lost and was never found again. I don't have time for mess like this. I'm not using any more apps for a Wi-Fi product. I'm sticking to the one I use for all my other devices and sending this garbage back!!!
customer_reviews.author: ButtaflyPoet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Range of Intensity and Colors
customer_reviews.text: I have six of these LIFX lights and three older ones. They are all excellent. The color range is infinite as is the brightness level using the LIFX app on my Apple iPhone or iPad. Voice control works very well with interface through the Apple Home app. Light schedules may be programed with infinite colors and intensity as desired. I also have a LIFX-Z lightstrp to illuminate my kitchen counter. I highly recommend this product. Their prices are coming down, so check back if they are more than your budget allows now.
customer_reviews.author: chaztoz

customer_reviews.title: simple setup and works great
customer_reviews.text: The bulb was same compact size as a regular light bulb. I'm impressed they fit all the smarts into a regular package. What I like that I can dim, turn on and off this bulb with ease using app on my phone . I can set schedule when it should turn on and off. It is very easy to use this bulb, just connect the hub to the app and scan the code on the bulb and it will appear on the app.
customer_reviews.author: Yash

customer_reviews.title: Great product, buggy Android app
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these lightbulbs and the colors and brightness are awesome. The only thing stopping me from giving this product 5 stars is it's Android app, every update for me seems to fix one thing and break something else in the app. for me right now if I try to create a scene it loses track of where my 2 lights are located and won't allow me to create a new scene. if this gets fixed I would give it 5 stars, still aside from the Android app, these are great light bulbs and look forward to getting a few more for my home.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Wallen

customer_reviews.title: LIFX will NOT support their products.
customer_reviews.text: PURCHASE AT YOUR OWN RISK. I purchased this bulb with an expectation it would work. It does not. The light stays on at 1% in color red. Resetting doesn't work. I could not find a phone number to call LIFX. I filled out a request to have the bulb replaced with all the information PROVIDED, serial number etc. LIFX support responded with a link to a non secured website I couldn't get to. It would have been much easier if they stated in the beginning that they don't replace or refund defective items. Do NOT purchase anything from LIFX.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Features LED Bulb
customer_reviews.text: I like everything this bulb can do. It was very easy to setup with the app. The many variations of white colors are impressive. I use this mostly as a mood/night light on 50% brightness and 2500k color. The app works very well, once you get used to where the settings are. I run it all night into the early morning, providing a nice nightlight if I need to come downstairs for something. Great quality LED bulb, been using it for almost 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Alan F.

customer_reviews.title: LIFX mini bulbs are junk. Stick to the larger ones.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one, couldn’t get it to connect to WiFi no matter what I did, Decided to buy a new one thinking the first was defective. Second one didn’t work. Tried in multiple homes, no matter what I did neither bulb will connect to WiFi, not even using HomeKit. Went to Home Depot to try to buy a third bulb there, only to see the only LIFX mini bulbs they had have all been RETURNED. This is nothing but junk. I’ve spent 4+ hours trying to connect with no luck. Stay away. I will say the A19 bulbs work fine though. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Not my first choice
customer_reviews.text: The product itself fetus quality, the seller is great, the bulbs kept losing connection and are a pain to reconnect. I have just sit everything "smart" possible in my home so I'm not new to this and these bulbs are difficult. They're great once setup assuming they stay connected. There are other bulbs that do what these do and have less problems
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Light and app work 10% of the time
customer_reviews.text: The light was great when it worked which is 10% of the time. The light will often disconnect from wifi sometimes requiring a full reset. The app would often not register the light and the integration with apple home seldom worked. For background, I'm using an IphoneX. I used a tplink bulb for comparison and had fewer issues.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Don't skimp TOO Much on Smart Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Hey, we all want more smart bulbs but it gets expensive replacing them all. So we look for bargains -- and find out with the headaches, compatibility issues and failures; its not smart to cheap out too much. After buying a boat load of different smart bulbs, I've settled on these for my basic needs. There are cheaper ones, and they mostly work. But there's a big difference in setup/config, maintenance and compatibility long term with Alexa & GHome. I like these a lot and have had no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: vardelda

customer_reviews.title: Lost connection, can't reconnect
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in April and it took quite a bit to get the lights to connect with the app (had to turn off some of my wireless networks so the lights weren't confused by a 5GHz and 2.4GHz network with the same name... About a month after having them working fine, one light flashed several times and disconnected from the app. I did the turn the lights on and off 5 times and wait to reset them all and they all lost their app connection. I have not been able to reconnect them in about a month. I'm really disappointed with these lights. I also have some Philips hue lights; I've never had a single problem with them.
customer_reviews.author: TexasAg97

customer_reviews.title: Item ruined my lamp
customer_reviews.text: This item fried my lamp. After 1 use my $200 lamp stopped working entirely. Completely ruined the lamp. I reached out to LIFX and they said "Unfortunately, compensation cannot be provided unless the fault is with the product itself, I am more than happy to replace the bulb under warranty". So their product ruined my lamp and their response was basically "too bad. Nothing will be done to compensate you". Bad product, worse company/customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Stein

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to see how this compared to the larger LIFX bulb
customer_reviews.text: I have the larger bulb in my lap and my wife has this new smaller one in hers. Both are being controlled by our echo show. WE LOVE THESE lights. No HUB, very easy to setup. In fact the echo show detected it and asked if we wanted to use this light bulb with the voice alexa feature. Couldnt be happier. In terms of brightness you do not really see a diff between the smaller bulb and the large one. Maybe about 5-10 % brighter.
customer_reviews.author: FR8Zilla

customer_reviews.title: After five days of use it doesn’t even turns on.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this was bundled with a new Echo Dot. What a disappointment . It has way too many steps to add. Way more steps and apps and registration steps than most smart products. I’ve tried. Finally got it To work and finally I had only enjoyed it for 5 days. After all of that set up ordeal Well, the light no longer comes on even with the switch. What a piece of garbage. i do not recommend this product, save your precious time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the original
customer_reviews.text: I bought the original LIFX's and they have a big problem staying on the network. So far, this one works great. The light is bright, great color selection and it's staying on the network.
customer_reviews.author: T.Tech

customer_reviews.title: Problems and more problems
customer_reviews.text: This is a big disappointment from LIFX. I have another model and it works flawlessly. From the beginning it has been having connectivity issues, requiring regular resets. Even with a new firmware, supposed to fix this issue, still having problems. I wish I could just return it. I regret not spending a little more and getting the regular model, not the mini.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bulb. Terrible app. Won't set up bulb.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bulb.. Great colors. Great features.. HOWEVER... The reason for my ONE Star review is, to use this bulb you must use the Lifx App... Therein lies the problem. The app hangs before bulb will set up. I have two of these bulbs... The first bulb set up easy. Adding second bulb, the app hangs and errors out before light will add.... Tried everything.... Long story short, now the app doesn't recognize the first bulb either. So.... I have two very expensive WHITE LIGHT BULBS.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harris

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: I have a few of these lights now and control them all with either Alexa or the LIFX app. Very easy to install and operate. I also like that I can use the lights in the old manual way if desired. When I use them manually and then turn them back on manually it takes a few seconds for them to sync again and I can adjust them through the app or Alexa once more. I also like the warm quality of the light.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S. Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Had to turn off VPN to add light bulb
customer_reviews.text: Easy procedure to add through the app BUT it wouldn't detect the bulb. I guessed it might be the VPN and sure enough, once i turned off the VPN the app detected the light bulb. After adding the bulb i turned VPN back on and it works fine. The colors, options and special effects are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Biggles

customer_reviews.title: doesnt work with apple homekit
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so i bought this as a gift for my mother to have and connect to her Alexa but it just wouldn't work. We put in it in her lamp it turned on, all went smooth till we got to the "connect to your wifi network" part. It wouldn't connect with apple home kit and im confused as to why? i bought one before and it worked perfectly fine with apple homekit. All it would tell me is that it was an uncertified product and wouldn't connect. Tried the trouble shooting steps and nothing. I dont recommend them as they aren't very reliable as a smart light. Brightness gets a 5/5, Connectivity gets a 0/5.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Seamless Smart Lighting
customer_reviews.text: These were my first experience with smart bulbs and I’ve been disappointed in every other smart bulb I’ve tried since! The LIFX bulbs have clear and simple instructions. The app functions as expected and the bulbs were recognized by the app on the first attempt. Once I paired the bulbs with the app, Alexa integration was a few more clicks. I only wish LIFX made E12 (candelabra) bulbs!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs, minor problems
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs, have 5 of them throughout my house. I have 3 outside that change colors automatically for the holidays and i don't have to purchase different bulbs. The only negative is that when the power goes out they have to be reset each time. I plan on purchasing more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lights that are a pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely lights that are a pain in the butt. They are not easy to set up and you have to jump through hoops to get them to work with Apple home. Once you screw the bulb in, you cannot see its code. The whole thing with the codes is a real pain. And god help you if you get a new modem with a new password, then every bulb has to be reset individually. One of my LIfx bulbs, the candle one, will not attach to my network at all and LIFX has been unresponsive
customer_reviews.author: Joe D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Rolling back my comments
customer_reviews.text: OK, So after fiddling with my WIFI security settings I finally got these to connect. They are bright and colorful. Which is cool. Unfortunately, they disconnect from the wifi on a regular basis. Also, the Day and Dusk settings are really hit or miss. I want to love these bulbs, but they are still really sketchy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Quality product. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Recently I added on a mini white lifx for $5 when I ordered an Alexa for my father as a Christmas present. I liked it so much that I decided to order a color bulb for my bedroom. I love it. Setup is so quick and easy, and the app is full of options. Even beyond that, these bulbs work great with ITTT. I made the mistake of buying a cheaper smart bulb before this one. That was a mistake. This brand will be my go-to from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Finicky, requires reset frequently. Poor light colors.
customer_reviews.text: Warm colors are unnatural and even reddish and not comparable to an incandescent or other modern warm LED bulbs such as the one’s made by Phillips or Fiet. The lack of need for a hub is cool, but One of the lights after a few weeks started dropping it’s wifi connection. So when I would turn on lights in a room it would stubbornly stay on or off. I reset it numerous times only to have it work for a day or two before failing again. It’s less than 10 feet from my Wifi router so it’s not an interference or range problem. All in all very disappointed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean A.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible user interface, terrible LIFX app, bulbs are not smart by any means.
customer_reviews.text: Really frustrated with these bulbs, the LIFX app is terrible and dealing with multiple bulbs has been a pain. The app doesn't allow you to delete various bulbs from groups. For example, I had one build labeled 'living room lamp' And when I moved it to the bedroom I couldn't rename it, even after resetting it, the app wasn't smart enough to recognize or allow me to change the 'group'. I would not recommend this bulb and would return this if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Josh. H

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely userfriendly . Will generate marital fights
customer_reviews.text: The lights are nice, good assembly and quality problem is that the app is not as friendly, it takes time to set up timers, and are usually off as they lose wifi connection when turned off from the switch, and they get disconnected from Router if you happen to have a electricity Shutdown in the house and you have to go all over the connection again... :( The only reason I am keeping them is because I use them on my Kids Rooms ceiling Fans and nobody invented yet the Dimmer Switch for lights and ceiling Fans... I am considering the return of these as I still have time until Jan 31st
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Luxo lamp
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of drafting lamps on my desk and when one of their bulbs died a couple of months ago, I decided to take a chance on integrating it into my LIFX collection and got my first Mini. I was worried it wouldn't be as bright as my full sized A19s, but the difference is not nearly as noticeable as I would have expected and provides as much light as the CFL that it replaces. In fact, given the price when on sale and the bulbs coverage over a larger surface area, I'll probably continue to buy more of these to expand my LIFX collection in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Shaky Dave

customer_reviews.title: Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Bulb looks great but having a hard time connecting it my my wifi. Was finally able to connect it to phone to use it but going to have to watch some videos to figure out what’s up with not connecting to wifi. It’s not plug and play for sure.
customer_reviews.author: OMGodz

customer_reviews.title: Frequent disconnects.
customer_reviews.text: They constantly disconnect from my network, causing me to reset them. LIFX support told me it was my own network, buy I have a set of the non-color LIFX bulbs that work just fine. I thought I'd like these over the hue bulbs since you don't need a bridge. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get to work with Google Home
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything and I couldn't get this to work with my Google Home setup so I returned it. I ended up with the C by GE that was recognized immediately and is still working. I have smart bulbs, thermostat, garage door, fans, irrigation timer and other stuff, so I'm not new to this. Hopefully this works for someone else. Maybe it's been enhanced since I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: surrealfrog

customer_reviews.title: I love these light bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these lightbulbs. They are soooo easy to setup compared to other brands. I’d get these every time over any other ones especially for the value for what you get. My daughter is not even that tech savvy and all I had to tell her was to download the app which it already tells you in the instructions and she figured it all out. Great job guys. Love love your product!!
customer_reviews.author: CPCO

customer_reviews.title: Lifx from Amazon is way cool. Start collecting
customer_reviews.text: Three in light fixture over kitchen island. You know how people will congregate in the kitchen at gatherings? Well fire up this big dog and jaws go slack. Everybody thinks they are the coolest thing and the were white just plain white! How did you change the bulbs? Always a trip and if someone is ignoring the happening, hit the strobe a few blasts. Now you have everybody wanting to know.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Cathey

customer_reviews.title: Good LIFX bulb but has limited tunability - full size has wider range
customer_reviews.text: This light bulb is great, like the regular LIFX A19 bulbs but it would be helpful to know that the tunability only ranges from 1500K to 4000K. The full size bulb goes all the way up to 9000K.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Set up is confusing
customer_reviews.text: I love this lightbulb and the ability to control it through Alexa. The set up instructions were not clear and it too me awhile to figure it out. You have to download the LIFX app and then make sure it is in the same WiFi network as your Alexa. You then have to enable the Alexa app to allow you to use the LIFX APP so you can control your device.
customer_reviews.author: ME Kluzak Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Great compact bulb. App is painful.
customer_reviews.text: Try and find a dimmable, wifi bulb that's Alexa compatible, doesn't require a hub AND will fit a smaller fixture. I looked for nearly a year. This one does it and it works great. You'll just need the patience of Job and the skills of a 12-year old gamer (or programmer) to get the app talking to Alexa. But not much harder than any other app/gizmo I've set up to work with Alexa (not counting the Harmony Hub .... YIKES!).
customer_reviews.author: Crawdaddy

customer_reviews.title: "USED: VERY GOOD"
customer_reviews.text: I saw there were 2 of these for a big discount because they were used. I have some others I've bought both new and used before and I love them, but when I opened the packages for the last 2 they were both regular incandescent light bulbs. So now I don't trust things that are used because apparently nobody actually checks the items to see if they're in usable condition, or even the correct item.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lights
customer_reviews.text: I use three to light my aquarium. The color reproduction is excellent and the day-night settings allow for a natural sunrise and sunset effect. Wish there was a way to add one or two more steps in the daylight simulation. The brightness between 1 and 10% is also a lot more defined compared to other bulbs I used in the past where everything under 10% was basically the same level of brightness.
customer_reviews.author: MR10C

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with 5ghz
customer_reviews.text: Why would anyone release a product that's only compatible with 2.4ghz networks? Normally this would be an annoyance, but if you have a mesh network, the only solution is to separate your networks and thereby break your mesh coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Etezadkhah

customer_reviews.title: The only thing keeping it from a 5-star review is ...
customer_reviews.text: The only thing keeping it from a 5-star review is that I can't change the light temperature within the Home App on my iPhone, I have to open their app to do this. The Home app does support color changing, so it's just that they have not integrated that with the app at the time of this writing.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Cornett

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea, but a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: When they work, these things are the bee's knees. They really are. But the problem is, they will rarely work. What I mean by this is that they will, constantly, simply stop responding. You will have to continually delete and re-install them from both the LIFX app and Homekit. It's been a colossal disappointment. It's great to be able to turn your lights on when you're out of town, but the aggravation that comes with setting these things up is too great - because you will have to set them up every week or so. Honestly, at this point, I wish we'd never bought them. A huge waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Stutterin' Steve

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get a Merkury light to work
customer_reviews.text: but this light installed pretty simply and works great. Once it's set up, there's another few steps to get it working with Alexa. So take your time. Install the light, get the APP, then turn on the light so the APP can find it. The Merkury light would connect and then disconnect so I returned it. Love Lifx.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: pairing is a challenge
customer_reviews.text: Still trying to get this thing to pair with my phone, great buld but not smart yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike60076

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with Alexa not with Apple HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: Shows as a network rather than a device. Once you connect it, the LIFX app will want you IT DOES NOT WORK WITH APPLE HOMEKIT. Alexa never recognized it. The LIFX app managed to pair with it but then couldn’t do anything with it. After an hour trying, I gave up. I’m returning it. It’s a great idea but the software does not work. DOES NOT WORK WITH ALEXA.
customer_reviews.author: Luis R. Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Works great outside
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my outside garage lights and they are working great. I was worried about the cold rating on them but so far so good. I live in Wisconsin and these lights have not failed yet even in -1 air temp with wind chills reaching -20 this week. They are in covered light fixtures so they have a little protection from the weather. No issues with wifi signal inside the light fixtures either.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lorge

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lights and everything about them but you can only have so many then they won’t work
customer_reviews.text: They work very well and it’s very cool to have them change color and go to the beat of the music but you can only have so many in the house I want to transfer all my bulbs but I bought more and none of them would end up working
customer_reviews.author: JayBeaty1013

customer_reviews.title: Simply Great Smart Light
customer_reviews.text: I did a good bit of research before getting my smart bulbs at home and I ended up on LIFX due to the brightness and simplicity of setting up. Pros: Little/No setup; Bright lights; Easy Integration with Nest, Alexa, and Ring; Look very similar to regular bulbs. Cons: I've had to send one back because it stopped working. However, the replacement was very simple and very quick!
customer_reviews.author: Ian McKee

customer_reviews.title: Pure garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these lights. After much hassle I was able to connect them. They worked well for about a month then both mysteriously dropped from the app. After extensive troubleshooting, following all of the prescribed steps, I was unable to reconnect. Lifx has NO TECH SUPPORT. There customer support is a joke -- practically nonexistent. Now I'm stuck with two useless "smart bulbs" that are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: I. Corson

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not good.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these 10 months ago and they worked great to begin with but now I have one that doesn't work at all. Oh sure you can manually turn it off and on but that's not the purpose of these lights. I have another Lifx light that I've had for several years and it works perfectly so this tells me their quality is no longer the same. I've also tried to get some technical support and all I can tell you is, don't bother, it's a total waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S.

customer_reviews.title: No dim bulb here!
customer_reviews.text: Love Lifx bulbs. First time I have purchased the smaller size. I was not disappointed. Easy “hook up” to wi-fi, both quality and operations exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.author: KewlDadiJ

customer_reviews.title: Great lights!
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights, I have used one for over a year now and bought my girlfriend one just the other day. I switch between using my phone and alexa and both work wonderfully for me! With alexa it does take about 3 seconds after turning on the lights switch for alexa to be able to adjust the color or brightness (which is very reasonable) my girlfriend uses google home and has had no problems for the few days she's used it so far. It is so easy to set up and to connect to both of those smart systems! I plan on buying more of these lights to automate more of my home over the next few years
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrie

customer_reviews.title: WiFi LED Light Bulb Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of using especially because I am so new to this.
customer_reviews.author: mimisgrand7

customer_reviews.title: Ken W
customer_reviews.text: Just installed a fan and these bulbs are perfect, many different colors to choose from for any mood. The pre-set themes are all pretty awesome also, very easy to set up and they work excellent with Alexa. Amazing how much light these small bulbs put out, if you’re on the fence take the plunge and purchase them. These will pay for themselves with the amount of time they will last, thoroughly endorse this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and connect to app, but lasted only one day. We were excited about these lights. Had to download another app to connect to Alexa. After 24 hours the bulb worked, but the "smart" features stopped. We troubleshooted for a week and were back and forth with customer service. Wasn't worth the headache.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer for kids' bedroom
customer_reviews.text: These little colored smart bulbs are a game changer for my children's' bedrooms. We have the schedule turned on to slowly brighten and wake them up in the mornings (rather than an alarm clock) and the same thing at night, it slowly dims til it goes off and my 3 year old knows that it is bed time! Another nice feature is being able to turn on a light for my son from the other side of the house, when he goes into his bedroom since he can't reach the light switch yet! haha. Definitely worth the price! We've had two of these for about a year now and they still work great!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bee

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Lifx Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Lifx bulbs kind of suck. They’re good when they work, but the WiFi is wonky and the reset process is a giant PITA. It’s the sort of thing that’s a lot easier to replace than fix, and not really expensive enough to warrant the effort that goes into it. I’d recommend a different brand of smart bulbs altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Max White

customer_reviews.title: One light quit working less than 4 weeks after purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: So, these are awesome, BUT my daughter's father got these for her birthday literally less than 4 weeks ago, and one is already dead. He contacted Amazon for a replacement and was told it's from a private seller, so they can't refund or replace anything. So, her 4-light fan is short one light now, and we're out $50 to buy her another bulb now. SUPER PISSED!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aame2012

customer_reviews.title: Will not pair, zero customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have a whole house of these, and they weren’t DIFFICULT to install. This was terrible, and after numerous hours and attempts, I still do t have a working bulb. Contacted LIFX and left message so they’ll call back for technical support. They never called back. Unless a miracle happens, I will return.
customer_reviews.author: Twiggle

customer_reviews.title: Constantly loses Connection
customer_reviews.text: I have many different types of smart bulbs throughout my house. Lifx bulbs are the best in brightness and color but are horrible at getting connected to the network and staying connected. For the price, they really need be fix this huge issue. I will not be buying anymore of these bulbs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Awful Setup
customer_reviews.text: It works ok as a regular bulb but I can't get it to connect. You have to install the lifx app. It finds the bulb, but it will not do the update to the bulb. It keeps coming up with an error. I would send it back but it only cost me $5 when I purchased with a Dot. I'll just use it as a regular bulb. :P
customer_reviews.author: Texas Electronics

customer_reviews.title: How much time do you have?
customer_reviews.text: After buying 23 of these bulbs at an average cost of $30 per piece they continually disconnect from the Wi-Fi at present I'm only working with half of my bulbs as the other half of decided not to play along anymore. Attempted several times to communicate with the manufacturer, but they are slow to respond to emails and do not offer phone support. If I was to make this decision again I would not go with this particular brand even though they are reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Big fan of these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of their Homekit support. Never had an issue with homekit support. It was very easy to set up and get connected to both Alexa and Homekit. In the year that I've been using this, it has maybe lost its connection to the network maybe 3 times at most. Maybe my only complaint is that I wish it was a tad brighter but overall that is a minor issue. I would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: J Overby

customer_reviews.title: great lights
customer_reviews.text: I got for google home mini. you download their app and then the app is found by the mini. I love the million colors, and how the light changes to the music - not as good as I had hoped, and I hope they can improve that feature in the future. Or is it future in the feature (ode to Groucho Marx - I couldn't resist)
customer_reviews.author: Swamiji — the Orange Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs will make you happy.
customer_reviews.text: I tried another brand of smart bulbs that were disappointingly dim—at full strength about the brightness of a nightlight. The LifeX Mini bulbs were recommended by a friend and they are a revelation with bright, crisp colors that illuminate the room. The preset blended color choices are many and well conceived. The special effects are clever. There’s a timer feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Won't link
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to link my bulb to Alexa since I received it. Have tried multiple, multiple times, sent a message to request help and no response. The instructions are circular ping ponging me back and forth between the Alexa app and the LIFX app. I'm so frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I spent 2 hours trying to connect to our WiFi and Alexa. I finally gave up. The LIFX app is awful. I’m looking for something that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: If looking for Alexa integration, don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Would connect to Home Kit, but would not connect to the LIFX app at all. Impossible to connect to Alexa if not in the LIFX app. As for producing light, it works. But if you want it to be smart, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Crifalcon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE Them!
customer_reviews.text: Expensive? Yes. Worth it? YESSSS! I don’t know why we never thought of using these lightbulbs before. We use our Google Mini to turn on the lights (voice) or the app on our phones. It’s all adjustable with brightness, hue, and individual lights. We love it! Bought another set for our dining room lights!
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but its allways getting disconnected . When i ask alexa to turn off or on the light it says it isn't responding . When it gets disconnected and need the light it wont turn on you have to reinstall it in the app or on and off lots of times with the switch . The brightness is nice but the features dont work
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Setup may take a little effort (if you have a 5g network and a 2.4ghz network, use the 2.4) but it isn't too bad. The app is easy, and the bulb works with a Google Assistant without a hub, and works with an Alexa without a hub. The "white" little a fairly brighr (800 lumens) and the range of possible colors is pretty wide, covering most of the rainbow, maybe a bit weak on the violet side.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Fantastic

customer_reviews.title: They don't connect
customer_reviews.text: These lights do not connect at all. They are theost inconsistent smart bulbs I've ever used. Hate them. Missed the return window by one day. I'll be tossing them in the trash. Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: ela

customer_reviews.title: Buy packages, 1 at a time is too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Great and super easy set up process. I have a love/hate with LIFX, love the help out of the products, all of them but these prices are absolutely insane. If it werent for Amazon and the internet, I wouldn't have any LIFX lights. Now I have 14 total between A19 and the Minis. Strips are next to run under the platform bed.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Pick a different brand!
customer_reviews.text: This light is terrible. It took forever for it to actually connect and then once it did it wouldn’t stay connected. We tried to reset to reconnect and now it won’t connect to any phones or apps. I bought some Sylavania ones the other day that work great and I’ve had no issues with.
customer_reviews.author: laura

product_meta.title: LIFX Mini 800-Lumen LED Light Bulb (L3A19MC08E26) Multi Colored - 1 Pack, 120 volts, 9W - New
product_meta.description:
Size:1 Pack| Style:Mini Color

LIFX Mini is the perfect “everywhere” Wi-Fi enabled LED light with millions of beautiful colors and whites—no hub required. LIFX Mini works with leading voice and smart home platforms and is Energy Star compliant. Wi-Fi Router Requirement - 802.11b,g,n standards compliant

Dimming: Software dimming 1% - 100%
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa (Alexa device sold separately), Apple HomeKit and the Google Assistant for voice control. Color Temperature-2500K to 9000K

Easy set up. LIFX screws in like any traditional light bulb. Simply download the app, connect to Wi-Fi and you're ready to go. No hub needed. LIFX lights are not compatible with your household dimmer switches. This is because we have built everything directly into the app, you can dim, change the colour and turn your lights on and off all from your smart device

Built in Wi-Fi & LIFX cloud. Offers full Lighting control via Wi-Fi with our LIFX iOS, Android and windows 10 apps. Ac cess your bulbs anywhere, anytime via the cloud. Voltage Range AC 100-240V 50/60 Hz. Wattage Use 9 Watts at full brightness
Adjustable and dimmable. Connected Lighting for your space, time of day, and mood. Choose from 16 million colors and a full range of warm to cool White with flexibility to dim
Intuitive control. Control lights individually or as Groups, set timers, pick from beautiful themes or create your own custom scenes
Bright & efficient. LIFX Mini Color has an output of 800 lumens, the equivalent of a 60W traditional incandescent bulb with the benefit of only 9W energy use. Designed for energy Star.

specifications.Included Components: LIFX Mini, A19 Edison Screw E26
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,060 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
